conclusion: The acceleration of a particle is the rate of change of its velocity with respect to time. In a velocity-time (v-t) graph, the acceleration is represented by the slope of the graph.
The given graph shows the velocity of a particle moving in a straight line as a function of time. We are asked to find the acceleration of the particle during the time interval from 1 to 3 seconds.
Looking at the graph, from t = 1 s to t = 3 s, the graph is a straight line.

premise: The graph is a straight line from t = 1 s to t = 3 s.
conclusion: This indicates that the acceleration is constant during this time interval.

To find the constant acceleration, we can calculate the slope of this straight line segment. The slope of a straight line is given by the change in the vertical coordinate divided by the change in the horizontal coordinate between any two points on the line. In this case, the vertical coordinate is velocity (v) and the horizontal coordinate is time (t). So, the acceleration is given by the formula: a = Δv/Δt = (v2 - v1)/(t2 - t1)
At t1 = 1 s, the velocity is v1 = 2 m/s.
At t2 = 3 s, the velocity is v2 = -2 m/s.

premise: Velocity at t1 = 1 s is v1 = 2 m/s and velocity at t2 = 3 s is v2 = -2 m/s.
conclusion: Calculate the acceleration using the formula: a = (v2 - v1)/(t2 - t1) = (-2 m/s - 2 m/s)/(3 s - 1 s) = -4 m/s / 2 s = -2 m/s²

The negative sign indicates that the acceleration is in the negative direction. Since the velocity is initially positive and then becomes negative, a negative acceleration means the velocity is decreasing in magnitude and eventually reverses direction.
At t = 2 s, the graph crosses the t-axis, so the velocity is v = 0 m/s.

premise: Velocity at t = 1 s is v = 2 m/s and velocity at t = 2 s is v = 0 m/s.
conclusion: Calculate the acceleration using the formula: a = (0 m/s - 2 m/s)/(2 s - 1 s) = -2 m/s / 1 s = -2 m/s²

premise: Velocity at t = 2 s is v = 0 m/s and velocity at t = 3 s is v = -2 m/s.
conclusion: Calculate the acceleration using the formula: a = (-2 m/s - 0 m/s)/(3 s - 2 s) = -2 m/s / 1 s = -2 m/s²
